Chuck Todd: s interview with Senate Minority Leader Harry Reid about the Supreme Court nomination of Merrick Garland by President Barack Obama on "Meet the Press" was used as evidence to verify the claim.
The fact that since 1900: there have been six Supreme Court nominations approved during lame-duck sessions was used to support Reid's claim that Democrats have never held up a Supreme Court nomination.
The historical context of Senate hearing: including the exception of Harriet Miers in 2005, was mentioned to provide additional perspective on the claim.
